summary: An email from an unidentified sender to attorneys Roy Black and Jack Goldberger regarding Jeffrey Epstein's deferred prosecution agreement, reminding them of the requirement to provide copies of proposed agreements with the State Attorney's Office and requesting the date and time of the change of plea.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Addressed as a recipient of the email regarding Jeffrey Epstein's deferred prosecution agreement, indicating he is involved in Epstein's legal representation.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Addressed as a recipient of the email regarding Jeffrey Epstein's deferred prosecution agreement, indicating he is involved in Epstein's legal representation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the deferred prosecution agreement being discussed, with the email concerning compliance with the agreement's terms.

connections.description: Roy Black is receiving correspondence about Epstein's deferred prosecution agreement, indicating he is part of Epstein's legal defense team.
Jack Goldberger is receiving correspondence about Epstein's deferred prosecution agreement, indicating he is part of Epstein's legal defense team.
Both are addressed together in the email regarding their client Jeffrey Epstein's legal matters.

events.title: Email Regarding Deferred Prosecution Agreement Compliance
events.description: An email is sent to Epstein's attorneys reminding them of the requirement to provide proposed agreements with the State Attorney's Office and requesting the date and time of the change of plea.

keyFacts: A deferred prosecution agreement exists for Jeffrey Epstein, requiring him to provide copies of proposed agreements with the State Attorney's Office to the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Epstein's attorneys, Roy Black and Jack Goldberger, are being reminded of this compliance requirement.
A change of plea is anticipated, as the email requests the date and time for it.
